oai_dc:dc.dc:title: United Colonies $6.00
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Revolutions; Money; Colonies
United States--History--Revolution, 1775-1783; Military currency
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The Continental Congress issued paper currency to finance the Revolutionary War. Continental currency was denominated in Spanish milled dollars. Without solid backing and easily counterfeited, the bills quickly lost their value, giving rise to the phrase "not worth a Continental."
